title: Board Game-Based Microlearning for Improving Computational Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Language-based vocational computing thinking education integrated with collaborative learning environments using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can establish problem-solving strategies within board games by applying algorithm design principles.
Learners can implement at least three types of game scenarios utilizing sequential, iterative, and conditional logic concepts.
Learners can engage in game design discussions and exchange feedback with peers via digital collaboration tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
